page.title: 06 Martinstown Today.
page.content: Martinstown has changed considerably in the life time of Mary Clarke(nee Bowring).It has seen a significant development of housing at its eastern end and there has even been an oil test drilling. In the last years the school has closed and village children now travel by bus to Dorchester Schools.Despite this Martinstown is increasingly popular as a residential area being attractively rural and within easy reach of Dorchester. Employment patterns have changed; most of the inhabitants do not work in the village and few are involved in its traditional occupation-farming. Those social activities associated with agricutural and once enjoyed by the village have faded away-barn dances,hay-making picnics and the November fair.
